Mahatma Gandhi, a prominent leader in India's struggle for independence from British rule, was assassinated on January 30, 1948. Nathuram Godse, a Hindu nationalist, shot him because he believed Gandhi favored Pakistan and was undermining Hindu interests .

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
Who assassinated Mahatma Gandhi and why?
Provide a reference.
ENDINSTRUCTION

Mahatma Gandhi was assassinated by Nathuram Godse on January 30, 1948. Godse was a Hindu nationalist who held the belief that Gandhi was favoring Pakistan and undermining Hindu interests. This assassination marked a tragic end to the life of one of India's most influential leaders.
